text: Using the search functionality, police personnel can search for a particular person, type of crime, modus operandi, property etc.
Citizens can use it as a tool to get information or acknowledgements from police.
The police in turn can use it to respond to citizens with very little turnaround time.
The solution should enable the user to track the submitted defect or enhancement request.
The System must keep an unalterable audit trail capable of automatically capturing and storing information.
The word “unalterable” is to mean that the audit trail data cannot be modified in any way or deleted by any user.
The System must maintain the audit trail for as long as required, which will be at least for the life of the case to which it refers.

The System must ensure that audit trail data is available for inspection on request, so that a specific event can be identified and all related data made accessible, and that this can be achieved by authorised external personnel who have little or no familiarity with the system.
This functionality can be used by external auditors who wish to examine or analyse system activity.
The system should provide for role-based control for the functionality within the system.
The System must allow changes to security attributes for groups or users (such as access rights, security level, privileges, password allocation and management) to be made only by super-user.
All error messages produced by the System must be meaningful, so that they can be appropriately acted upon by the users who are likely to see them.
Customers will be able to add and store products for purchase within the shopping cart.
The system will implement an Application Interface to allow for various plug-ins to interact with the system.

Department administrator have control on his department inventory

The MultiMahjongServer will allow players on MultiMahjongClient programs to chat with each other in real time.
The MultiMahjongServer will have a graphical user interface with which the administrator of the server can get log information and change game settings.
Users who create a new game will be able to change the ability level of any CO involved in the game.
The list of un-started games that the MultiMahjongClient fetches from the MultiMahjongServer will be displayed in such a way that users can see the following information about each game.
The MultiMahjongClient must only allow players to make moves according to the Chinese rules of Mahjong as described in the rulebook, "How to Play Mah Jong".
The MultiMahjongClient will inform the user whose turn it is to pick up a tile.
User's will be able to pick up a tile from the wall if it is their turn.
User's will be able to chat with each other in real time.
The user will be able to end the game at any stage of the game.

The HATS-GUI shall suggest a file name for the user whenever it prompts the user to enter a file name.
The HATS-GUI shall provide for repeating a search.

The RLCS software shall send to and receive data from the field device I/O cards through I/O driver software.
The system shall control all system field elements to device sensor level for those device sensors that may be controlled.

Ability to select a privacy policy that has been assigned to them by the project manager.
The system shall allow analysts to add a scenario to the system.
The system shall allow analysts to graphically view the allowable flows for specific types within an organization and across multiple organizations given a set of access control policies.
The Clarus system shall collect, quality control, and disseminate environmental data.
The Clarus system shall accept environmental data derived from images.
The Clarus system shall accept surface condition data derived from surface images.
The Clarus system shall accept atmospheric condition data derived from atmospheric images.
The Clarus system shall acquire and disseminate National Weather Service (NWS) watches, warnings, and advisories.
The Clarus system shall provide environmental data quality flags.
The Clarus system shall not modify original observations.
The Clarus system shall be able to implement quality control rules for each environmental parameter.
The Clarus system shall be able to implement quality control rules for specific environmental situations.
The Clarus system shall be able to detect data submission errors.
The Clarus system shall minimize the time for data dissemination.
The Clarus system shall be able to disseminate data based on spatial queries.
The Clarus program shall alert users to system modifications.
The Clarus system shall log data transactions.
The Clarus system shall accept data through a Clarus standard interface.
The Clarus system shall be able to communicate with an individual ESS through its native interface.
The Clarus system shall be able to collect environmental data that are manually entered.
The Clarus system shall transfer data as efficiently as possible.
The Clarus system shall allow users to create a data subscription request.
The Clarus system shall be able to be hosted at one or more physical locations.
The Clarus system shall be able to prioritize data handling for time-critical data.
The Clarus system shall be able to publish new data within twenty minutes of data receipt.
The Clarus system shall be able to handle three hundred simultaneous requests for environmental element data.
The Clarus system shall be able to support six thousand registered users.
The Clarus program shall maintain continuous 24x7 operations.
The Clarus program shall provide network management tools.
The Clarus program shall provide a trained support staff.
The Clarus program shall define data retention standards.
The Clarus program standards shall support multiple methods of data delivery to users.
The user should have the ability to see (at a glance) the differences of various selected attributes of their data.
The product should allow the grid to be oriented by the user. Rotation, zoom and move functions should be employed.
The application should be coloured so that the screen shots can be printed out clearly (i.e., black on white background).
The application should be intuitive and not require any specialist training.

Systems supporting OM should have the ability to produce individual reports for each emergency team member or investigator.

The user shall be able assign Pontis-generated work recommendations, inspector work candidates, and user-specified work items to a project, or remove work items from a project.

The system shall be capable of tracking login and logout activity.

The system shall enable user to enter the search text on the screen.
The system shall display only 10 matching result on the current screen.
The system shall enable user to navigate between the search results.
The system shall authenticate user credentials to view the profile.
The system shall allow user to select the order from the order history.
The system shall display the most frequently searched items by the user in the profile.
The system shall allow user to enter the customer and product information for the support.
The system shall send an order confirmation to the user through email.
The system shall optionally allow user to print the invoice.
The system shall display tentative duration for shipping.
The system shall display the current tracking information about the order.
The system shall allow user to select the payment method for order.
The system shall display the orders that are eligible to change.
The system shall allow user to cancel the order
The system shall allow user to change shipping, payment method.
The system shall allow user to view detailed sitemap.
The system shall display all the available promotions to the user.

The system shall automatically log out all customers after a period of inactivity.

The DUAP Input Services shall be able to collect probe vehicle data from the Chrysler Fast Feedback (telematics demonstration) fleet using the Chrysler telematics interface.
The DUAP System shall be able to collect weather data.
The DUAP Input Services shall be able to collect weather data from the MDOT RWIS using the MDOT RWIS interface.
The DUAP Input Services shall be able to collect traffic data from the Detroit TMC system using the Detroit TMC interface.
The DUAP System shall be able to collect traveler information.
The DUAP Input Services shall be able to collect road condition data from Traffic Management Systems (TMS) using the TMS interface.
The DUAP Computational Services shall be able to derive speed from probe vehicle data.
The DUAP System shall be capable of adding new data sources.
The System shall provide the capability to operate in an Open Mode, within which authorized customers shall be allowed read-only access to requested Data Products. This is the nominal system mode.
The System shall be capable of rendering Mercator projections.
The System shall be capable of aggregating Data Products up to and including one orbit.

Actors in the role of course administrators should have the ability to determine which of these components have feeds and to whom these feeds should pertain.
Actors in the course administrator role may not feel the need to provide web feeds for every page in their course.
When the actor clicks a search result link, they should be taken to the page corresponding to the search result.
If the actor is hierarchically inside of a course, that course should be searched with an option to search all courses.
Course administrators should be able to post grades for an assignment based on the ratio of points earned to points possible.
The system should maintain a history of grades for a particular assignment if the course administrator changes them.
The system must provide a blog engine.
the actor in the role of course administrator should be able to toggle whether notifications are turned on.
A system will be considered to meet this requirement if it has a single administrative interface rather than individual links for editing each page.
Furthermore, this interface must allow administrators to easily change themes and other setting that affect page layout across the entire courseware system.
The system should be backed up with a frequency that ensures system and course data is protected.

Policy Repository virtualizes all of the policies within a peering arrangement including PWS, PM, and PP, along with any delegated policies for resources as a result of the peering arrangement.
Policy Repository provides a set of rules to the mediator to administer, manage, and control access to the resources in a peering arrangement.
Peering Agent acts as a policy-driven resource discovery module for establishing negotiations.
Hotspot is generated and provider is unable to handle excess load on its Web server.
Local Peering Agent communicates with the Peering Agent of peers to discover external resources.
Peering Agent exchange content availability and load information to identify an optimal peer to handle user requests.
Request is redirected to an optimal peer’s Web server.
